displayInfo: The ultimate guide for Lite Island.

properties.text:
Welcome to Lite Island! This is a 1.12 lightweight Skyblock pack based on Ex Nihilo Creatio. 

Unlike other usual kitchen sink Skyblock packs (e.g. Sky Factory, All The Sky, etc.), this pack includes lots of different recipe tweaks, including recipes for creative items, making the pack even more challenging. This pack is not intended to be an "expert" pack, while certain things are made to be slightly more difficult, extending the playtime a bit more.

This guide book will guide you through playing the whole pack, from the start till the end.

If you are new to Modded Minecraft, this book will help you a lot.

Alright, let's get started!

Turn to the next page and start the journey.

Note: This guide only include the very basics of things, look up in-game manuals or search online if you need to know further.

Have fun!
- Jacky

Getting Started

The first thing you do in Minecraft - punch some trees! You should have given 8 Oak Saplings as one of the starting items. Depending on the world type you've chosen, planting saplings might be optional, but if you need to plant the saplings, you can twerk / sprint to accelerate tree growth!
After you've got some wood, it's better to get the basics of Tinkers' Construct. Craft the following items and place them together!

After you've got the basics of Tinkers' Construct, time to work on getting resources!

Again, depending on the world type, resources are being gathered in many different ways. If you're using Garden of Glass, you can shift right click Grass Blocks / Dirt for Pebbles, then you can craft them into Cobblestone! If you're on a regular Skyblock world (i.e. world type is "Void World"), things are a bit more difficult. First, you'll need a Crook. Break Leaves with the Crook to get Silkworms. Right click on leaves with Silkworms to infest them. Then use a Crook on the fully infested leaves to get String.

You'll need to make some Barrels and compost some Dirt, then sieve the Dirt in Sieves. There are two types of Sieves, regular ones and heavy ones. Regular ones can form a multiblock up to 5x5 as to increase the sieve efficiency. Heavy ones are made to sieve compressed blocks, you get more drops at once, but they cannot form a multiblock.
You'll also need meshes to put into the sieves. Keep in mind that different meshes drops different items from the same block. Check JEI for what they drops!

After you've got these set up, you're able to sieve your dirt to get Pebbles and craft them into Cobblestone!

Craft a Hammer to smash your Cobblestone into Gravel, Sand or Dust. Sieve them and get the resources you need!

Compressed Hammers are handy if you want to smash some compressed blocks down!

If you want a constant supply of Cobblestone, it might be a great idea to make a Cobblestone generator! But to get that, you'll need Lava. Make an Unfired Crucible, smelt it down, put it on top of a heat source (check usage for Crucible on JEI to see possible heat sources), put some Cobblestone into the Crucible and wait, you'll get Lava! You can either make a Bucket out of Iron or Clay, depends on what you want!

In order to get Water for an infinite Water source, or making Clay, you can either place down some Barrels and wait for rain, or make a Wooden Crucible.

A Wooden Crucible takes items like Sapling, and turn them into Water. Unlike the regular Crucible, you don't need a heat source for Wooden Crucibles. Just place it down and it'll work.
There are 2 types of Cobblestone generators, the traditional one and a single block from Tiny Progressions. Just go for whatever you want!
At this point, you're pretty good on the resources, it's probably time to make a Smeltery. A Smeltery is a multiblock structure that allows you to double ores and make metal Tinkers' tool parts.
A basic 5x5 Smeltery.
If you don't want to do a Smeltery, there's also a Melter, it's a smaller version of Smeltery. A Melter doesn't double ores, only 1.5x, plus it doesn't create alloys.
A Melter setup.

A better way of getting resources

Tired of constantly sieving? There's actually a Mining Dimension for getting ores and some other resources.

Mining Dimension is an all-purpose superflat dimension made for mining, farming, etc. It is an easy way of gathering resources for things like Extreme Reactors and other tech mods.

In order to go to the Mining Dimension, first of all, you'll need a Mining Multitool:
Then craft some Portal Frames:
Creating a Mining Dimension portal is relatively simple, just build it like how you build a Nether portal, then right click the inner portal frame with the Mining Multitool.
Hold sneak and walk through the portal, and you'll be in the Mining Dimension:
You can also find AE2 meteors and slime islands in the Mining Dimension. Chance Cubes and Lucky Bean trees also spawn in there, so good luck!

Alternatively, there's also another mining dimension called Deep Dark. It's a dimension without sky light, very dark, but ores generation are much denser in there. Mobs health doubles in the Deep Dark, players also takes damage in the darkness. It's a dangerous, yet rewarding dimension.

Power generation

There are multiple ways of generating power, as known as Redstone Flux (RF). This guide book will only include a few of the basic power generators. If you want to know further, discover them yourself.

Magmatic Generator / Dynamo

This type of generators runs on Lava, you'll have to constantly feed them with Lava in order for them to generate power.

Furnace fuels / Coal-based Generators

This type of generators runs on any Furnace fuels or Coal.

Renewable power generators

This type of power generators don't consume anything to generate power. They rely on the environment (e.g. Sun, Wind, Water, etc.) to generate power. While they can be efficient, there are limitations with certain generators (like solar panels) can only generate power at certain time (in solar panels' case, only day time).
For how to set up the generators in Immersive Engineering, please check out the Engineer's Manual for details.

Reactors

Reactors are a type of powerful, yet expensive generators. They're multiblock structures, requires fuel and coolants.

A basic Reactor consists Reactor Casings (as frame at least), Reactor Glass (optional), Reactor Controller, Reactor Access Port(s), Reactor Fuel Rod(s), Reactor Control Rod(s), Reactor Power Tap(s) and a minimum exterior size of 3x3x3.
To see how to build a 3x3x3 reactor, go to the next page.

Storage System

Are you getting fed up with having loads of chests and don't know where to find the items you need? Well, AE2 is the solution.

AE2 (or full name as Applied Energistics 2), is a mod that allows you to create massive storage systems, autocrafting and has many unlimited potentials!

To get started with AE2, you'll need some Certus Quartz and some Charged Certus Quartz, either from sieving or mining (check JEI to see details).
After you've got them, you'll need to make an Energy Acceptor. This block converts RF (or other energy units) into AE, the energy unit used in AE2.
Since Charged Certus Quartz are much rarer than regular Certus Quartz, it's better to have a Charger.

Next thing you'll need is an Inscriber, which is a machine needed to create processors.

Processors are one of the key components in most of the AE2 recipes.

To create processors, you'll also need presses. There are 4 different types of press: Logic, Engineering, Calculation and Silicon. You can either create presses via Mystical Agriculture (it's quite straight forward, look up on JEI and you'll understand pretty much most of it) or find the presses in meteors.  Meteors can be found in the Overworld (not void world) and Mining Dimension.
All of the processors and presses.

ME Drive is one of the important parts for an AE / ME system. Make sure it's attached to the AE network, either place it next to the Energy Acceptor or connect the drive and the acceptor via ME cables. ME Drive has 10 internal slots for Storage Cells. Note that any storage cells can only store up to 63 item types per cell regardless their size.

In order to store / withdraw items into the Storage Cells, you'll need a ME Terminal. There's also an upgraded version of the ME Terminal called ME Crafting Terminal, which includes a 3x3 crafting grid, allows you to craft items directly using the items stored in the network.
Here's an example of a basic AE / ME system:

Introduction to Channels

You may have noticed this appears on top of the screen:

So what exactly are Channels?

Channels are part of AE2, each parts (except Charger, Inscriber and Crystal Growth Accelerator / Chamber) occupies a Channel. Energy Acceptor can only output 8 Channels, which is not enough for a massive system...

This is when ME Controller comes in handy. ME controller is an upgraded version of Energy Acceptor and it can form a multiblock frame (up to 7x7x7). ME Controller can output 32 Channels per side. Keep in mind that Glass, Covered and Smart Cables can only transfer 8 Channels, you'll need Dense Cables in order to trasfer all 32 Channels.

Exploration

There's actually not just the vanilla dimenions and mining dimensions. This pack provides 2 more dimenions for you to explore. They are: The Lost Cities and The Twilight Forest.

The Lost Cities

The Lost Cities is a dimension that's full of abandoned structures. There can be loads of loots inside those structures, but also full of danger.

To construct a portal to The Lost Cities is very simple but also quite expensive, you need 6 Skulls (any types), 2 Diamond Blocks and a Bed of any colors.
Also, do note that you'll need an extra portal to come back if you don't want to use /home or /spawn.
After you've constructed the portal, right click on the Bed and it should bring you to The Lost Cities...

The Twilight Forest

As for The Twlight Forest, the portal is unique compare to The Lost Cities.

You need: at least 2 Buckets of Water, at least 8 vanilla Flowers of any types, at least 8 pieces of Dirt / Grass Blocks and a piece of Diamond.

To start constructing the portal, you need to have a 2x2 infinite Water source surrounded by Dirt or Grass Blocks with the Flowers on top (corner blocks are completely optional).
After the portal is constructed. throw a piece of Diamond into the pool of Water. You should see a lightning strike and the portal is formed!
Jump into the portal and it'll bring you to The Twilight Forest!
The Twilight Forest unlocks different areas by Advancements, so, look at your Advancements and see how to unlock different areas!
By the way, if you want to go to The End, just make an End Cake, fill it with Eyes of Ender and right click on the cake!

Late game to end game

When you have lots of resources and have flight, consider yourself have entered the late game to end game stage!

First thing you probably want to start in the late game stage is Draconic Evolution as you'll need the Fusion Crafting system to craft certain creative items.

Draconic Evolution is a fairly straight forward mod as it's simple and has a guide book (Draconic Evolution Information Tablet). You'll want to check out the Tablet for things related to Fusion Crafting.

Avaritia is another mod that you'll have to work on apart from Draconic Evolution as you'll need its Extreme Crafting Table for crafting creative items.

To start off, first craft an Extreme Crafting Table. It has a 9x9 crafting grid interface.

Secondly, craft some Neutron Collectors and place them down. Neutron Collectors collects tiny piles of Neutrons. Do note that the collectors are rather slow, so you'll need quite a lot of them.
Tiny piles of Neutrons are used to craft Neutronium Ingots, which are used in quite a few Extreme Crafting recipes.
Here are all the creative items that you can craft (check JEI for recipes):
After you've crafted all of the creative items listed above, consider yourself have beaten this pack!
That's all for this guide book, hope you enjoy this pack!
